void EngineUtil::checkCelChipTypes ( std::vector< std::string > &  chipTypes,
uint32_t  probeCount,
std::vector< std::string > &  celFiles,
uint32_t  rows,
uint32_t  cols 
) [static]

Check to make sure all the cel files are compatible with the chiptypes supported and number or probes on them.

Treats the empty string "" as a wildcard, so if chipTypes contains "" then any chip type is accepted, but only if number of probes is correct. Calls Err::errAbort() if something is wrong.

Parameters:
chipTypes - Names of chiptypes that are compatible.
probeCount - How many probes (aka features, ada cels) should be on array.
celFiles - Vector of cel file names to check.

bool EngineUtil::checkChipTypeOk ( const std::string &  qType,
const std::vector< std::string > &  possibleTypes 
) [static]

Return true if the qType of chip is found in the list of possible types that are ok.

Note that this is a case sensitive operation and is meant to be so.

Note that this is a case sensitive operation and is meant to be so. We want to be restrictive to avoid problems later on. Filesystems we care about are at least case-preserving (HFS+)

void EngineUtil::getCdfChipType ( std::vector< std::string > &  chipTypes,
colrow_t &  rowCount,
colrow_t &  colCount,
int &  probeCount,
int &  probeSetCount,
const std::string &  cdfFile 
) [static]

Open up a cdf file and get the chip type (i.e.

'Mapping250K_Sty') and number of probes on the chip.

Parameters:
chipTypes - Names of chiptypes that this pgf file is compatible with.
rowCount - Number of rows on the chip.
colCount - Number of columns on chip.
probeCount - Number of probes that are on chip according to clf file.
cdfFile - Name of cdf file to be opened and read from.

int &  probeCount,
const std::string &  pgfFile,

Open up a pgf and clf file pair and read the valid chiptypes (i.e.

HuEx-1_0-st-v2, HuEx-1_0-st-v1, HuEx-1_0-st-ta1) and number of probes expected from them.

Parameters:
chipTypes - Names of chiptypes that this pgf file is compatible with.
probeCount - Number of probes that are on chip according to clf file.
pgfFile - Name of pgf file to be opened and read from.
clfFile - Name of clf file to be opened and read from.
